other_tests.procedure_name: Total thyroidectomy and left modified radical neck dissection
other_tests.findings: Pathological findings were consistent with lymphocytic thyroiditis and multifocal Medullary Thyroid Carcinoma (MTC) involving the left lobe, isthmus, and right lobe of the thyroid with evidence of metastatic disease in 39 out of 44 lymph nodes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At last follow-up, 30 years after initial diagnosis, there was no radiological evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease.

other_tests.findings: No corneal nerve thickening suggestive of MEN2B.
The examination revealed an enlarged inhomogeneous thyroid gland with no discrete nodules in patient II-13.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient's baseline serum calcitonin was less than 0.7 ng/liter, with a peak of 28 ng/liter after a calcium infusion test.

other_tests.findings: Showed two foci of microscopic MTC and extensive C cell hyperplasia in the background of Hashimoto's thyroiditis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Thirteen lymph nodes removed were found to be negative for metastatic MTC.
